issue.title: [CF 344] TMW not opening
issue.body:
FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
Only happens when I log on to one specific server (Undermine) - TMW will not open/load.  /tmw will not pop it open.  It shows as an active addon under Interface>Addons but when I highlight the name, nothing appears - the whole settings area is blank.

Just realized that this does not affect toons on other servers, just toons on the one server.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
Expect to configure TMW; TMW does not open.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
4.6.6

Do you have an error log of what happened?
Message: [string "TellMeWhen_BlizzOptionsStub:OnShow"]:1: attempt to call method 'LoadOptions' (a nil value)
Time: 11/20/11 22:54:50
Count: 1
Stack: [C]: in function `LoadOptions'
[string "*:OnShow"]:1: in function <[string "*:OnShow"]:1>
[C]: in function `Show'
Interface\FrameXML\InterfaceOptionsFrame.lua:28: in function `InterfaceOptionsList_DisplayPanel'
Interface\FrameXML\InterfaceOptionsFrame.lua:46: in function `InterfaceOptionsListButton_OnClick'
[string "*:OnClick"]:2: in function <[string "*:OnClick"]:1>

Locals:

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

I figure it's some file I've got to clear, but I've erased all my .lua files and cannot figure out what I need to get rid of to make it operational again.


> Posted by CurseForge user thewolfwalker | Imported from CurseForge issue #344 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: TellMeWhen.lua

TellMeWhen.lua

<p>saved variables file</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user thewolfwalker

This is absolutely mind-boggling. Have you tried deleting TellMeWhen and TellMeWhen_Options from your Interface/Addons folder and reinstalling the addon?

Your saved variables are not the issue here. The issue is that the core of TMW (TellMeWhen/TellMeWhen.lua) is not loading for some reason. TellMeWhen.xml is loading just fine, though. Have you installed a no-lib version and you are missing certain libraries? A missing library would certainly cause errors in the loading process.

What I would recommend you do next (if reinstalling does not work) is to install BugGrabber and BugSack (both are required and both can be found on Curse.com). These addons will catch every single error that occurs in TellMeWhen's loading process (I am 99.99% sure there is another error that is occurring before the one you posted that is the cause of the problem.) When you load WoW, click on BugSack's minimap icon, and post each error that has been caught. Click the "Previous" and "Next" buttons to scroll through all the errors.

Sorry for all the trouble this has caused you, and thank you for working with me to get this resolved.

Edited Nov 21, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you so much for helping me troubleshoot. When I noticed TMW did not load the first time, all I did was uninstall/reinstall via the Curse client. After that failed to fix the problem, I manually deleted the files from my Interface>Addons folder + all the .lua files in my account folder.

I did absolutely NOTHING that I can think of that would have changed the state of the addon. I just logged on one day and it didn't load. I had no installed or uninstalled anything prior to that (except maybe - I can't remember - maybe I updated other addons via the Curse client?).

I just uninstalled/reinstalled TMW as well as BugGrabber and BugSack. Here are the errors from BugSack (17/17 of them - damn!):

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\TellMeWhen.lua:83: attempt to call field 'Warn' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\default.lua:73: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\cooldown.lua:223: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\item.lua:234: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\runes.lua:169: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\unitcooldown.lua:381: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\icd.lua:186: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\multistate.lua:168: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\reactive.lua:184: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\buff.lua:257: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\wpnenchant.lua:230: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\totem.lua:174: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\dr.lua:244: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\cast.lua:127: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\conditionicon.lua:155: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\Types\meta.lua:166: attempt to call method 'RegisterIconType' (a nil value)

1x TellMeWhen-4.6.6\conditions.lua:65: hooksecurefunc(): OnInitialize is not a function TellMeWhen-4.6.6\conditions.lua:65: in main chunk


> Posted by CurseForge user thewolfwalker

Thanks for posting those errors. I found the problem and it is fixed in the latest alpha (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/404-r313/).

A side note: this was happening because you have not upgraded from ButtonFacade to Masque, the successor of ButtonFacade. Seeing as Masque has been out for a little over a month now, I removed the legacy support for ButtonFacade, and in order to let users know about this, I included a notification of this, but I coded it wrong so it was causing errors, to say the least.

Edited Nov 21, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

It's working now! Thank you very much!


> Posted by CurseForge user thewolfwalker
